result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Mark A Wolff

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Mark A Wolff appeared by video.  Attorney William Anthony Rakestraw Ii in court for Mark A Wolff.  Attorney Annie Louk for Abby Rockendorf in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for calendar call. Defendant appeared by zoom due to being in Madison for treatment. Based on defendant's appearance in court, by zoom, Court cancels stayed bench warrant. Defense received discovery and offer and request status conference date. Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 16; VIA ZOOM. Status conference scheduled for December 2, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Mark A Wolff not in court.  Attorney William Anthony Rakestraw Ii in court for Mark A Wolff.  Attorney Abby Rockendorf in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for Scheduling Conference. Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed the issuance until the next court date. Case adjourned for a Calendar Call to Br 16.
Calendar call scheduled for October 21, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Mark A Wolff appeared by video.  Attorney William Anthony Rakestraw Ii appeared by video for Mark A Wolff.  Prosecuting attorney Abby Rockendorf in court in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 16, Judge Grayson. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 16.
Scheduling conference scheduled for October 13, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire & Waiver
Justice Point Pretrial Services Supervision Report received and filed.  nk
State Public Defender - Order Appointing Counsel.  Received and Filed.  nk
Justice Point Pretrial Services Violation Report received and forwarded to Judge for review.  nk
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grayson, Branch 16. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 25, 2022 at 10:00 am.
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea

Defendant Mark A Wolff in court with attorney Connor Romenesko.  Defendant Mark A Wolff in custody at Jefferson County Jail.  Jennifer L Pickett appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Mark A Wolff appeared by video means with Attorney.  Court ordered bench warrant withdrawn.  Recall issued.  MCSO did not provide executed warrant at time of scheduling.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE ARREST WARRANT.

Defendant Mark A Wolff not in court.  John Daniel Flynn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued. Upon arrest, defendant is ordered remanded to a commissioner. Court ordered any bail on deposit to be forfeited. The forfeiture order is stayed for 30 days pending notice to the defendant. Court makes a finding that there is no possible victim identified, therefore, restitution is not an issue.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 7-6-2022 @1p
